intro: Myrmechis japonica var. sasakii, commonly known as the Japanese antler plant, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically divided into fine, thread-like segments, giving it a delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
